class.name: EditorSpinSlider
class.brief_description: Godot editor's control for editing numeric values.
class.description: This [Control] node is used in the editor's Inspector dock to allow editing of numeric values. Can be used with [EditorInspectorPlugin] to recreate the same behavior. If the [member Range.step] value is [code]1[/code], the [EditorSpinSlider] will display up/down arrows, similar to [SpinBox]. If the [member Range.step] value is not [code]1[/code], a slider will be displayed instead.

members.member: If [code]true[/code], the [EditorSpinSlider] is considered to be editing an integer value, and the drag speed will be set to [member EditorSettings.interface/inspector/integer_drag_speed]. If [code]false[/code], the [EditorSpinSlider] is considered to be editing a floating-point value, and the drag speed will be set to [member EditorSettings.interface/inspector/float_drag_speed]. [b]Note:[/b] Integers uses the up/down arrows by default similar to [SpinBox], unless [member integer_prefer_slider] is set to [code]true[/code] which will use the slider instead. [b]Note:[/b] Floats uses the slider by default, unless [member float_prefer_arrows] is set to [code]true[/code] which will use the up/down arrows instead.
If [code]true[/code], the slider will not draw background.
If [code]true[/code], up/down arrows will be used instead of slider when [member editing_integer] is disabled.
Neither the up/down arrows nor the slider will be shown.
If [code]true[/code], the slider and up/down arrows are hidden.
If [code]true[/code], a slider will be used instead of up/down arrows when [member editing_integer] is enabled.
The text that displays to the left of the value.
If [code]true[/code], the slider can't be interacted with.
The suffix to display after the value (in a faded color). This should generally be a plural word. You may have to use an abbreviation if the suffix is too long to be displayed.
